page.title: 03FOXPARK RESERVOIR 2
page.content: supply right down to the south of Cornwall. Foxpark took over one year to build and was finished in 1978. In the next four years it is hoped to extend the reservoir to double its size. The water board has worked very hard to comply with conservancy regulations. From the road one can only see a goarse covered, rocky Tor. A computer carefully monitors the water level so that there is no overspill of clean chlorinated water running down into the ponds of the Redmoor Nature Reserve and uppsetting the wildlife balance.
